quest.name: Reclamation
journal: Alphinaud is ready to return to the Waking Sands.
Before you can contemplate tackling the Empire's terrifying new weapon, the Scions of the Seventh Dawn must be reborn. Return to the Waking Sands with Cid and Alphinaud.

Within the echoing halls of the Waking Sands, you are reunited first with Yda and later Y'shtola, to the surprise and delight of all concerned. The pair reveal that they have spent the days since the raid searching for information on the location of the Scions taken prisoner by the Empire. What is more, Y'shtola's latest inquiries have borne fruit: your comrades are being held at Castrum Centri, an imperial stronghold in Mor Dhona. While the others begin to digest this news, you are left to reflect instead on the cryptic warning imparted to you by Hydaelyn in yet another vision...
objectives: Speak with Alphinaud in the Waking Sands.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It is past time that we return to the Waking Sands.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: To leave our headquarters in disrepair any longer would be to dishonor the memory of those who fell there.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We have been brought to our knees, but we will rest, rebuild, and rise once more.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Tell me, Forename...does aught here strike you as odd? I see signs of recent habitation. Could it be that we have trespassers?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hm. Mayhap it is just my imagination. Come, let us proceed into the solar.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Wait.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Who goes there!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Now, now, Yda─is that any way to greet a friend?

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Alphinaud! Forename!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Cid!? Wait, is this a dream?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Not that I'm aware of! It's been a while, Yda.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: I...I don't believe it... I was sure you'd been─

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: This place has seen better days.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Uh...you know, I wasn't actually here when... I-I was still in talks at the Adders' Nest...

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: The first I knew about it was when I came back, and...and I saw...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Yda...

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: The church had taken care of the bodies, but that still left...the stains... I-It was hard to know where to start... If Y'shtola hadn't been here to help me─

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Y'shtola is here too?

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Yes. But she's not here right now. She's gone to Ul'dah to meet a man who might know what happened to the others.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Papalymo and Minfilia weren't among the dead, according to the church. Y'shtola thinks they were taken somewhere.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Upon the orders of the Black Wolf, no doubt.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: ...Why would he want them?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Because they possess something he desires: knowledge of another power that can be brought to bear against the primals─one that Gaius has yet to harness...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Echo.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Gaius will be aware of its existence, as well as the immunity it grants the gifted to the primals' influence.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Powerful though his Allagan weapon may be, he would doubtless desire such protection.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: He means to use Minfilia to gain an understanding of the Echo.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...None of which explains how the Empire came to know the location of the Waking Sands in the first place...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: No matter. The Empire has shown its hand, and now we must act. It is up to us to rebuild the Scions and save Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Can I count on you, Yda?

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: What? Oh, yes─yes, of course! Whatever you need!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We can discuss our next move upon Y'shtola's return.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: For now, I say we rest.

dialogue.name: HYDAELYN
dialogue.text: Hear... Feel... Think...

dialogue.name: HYDAELYN
dialogue.text: Bringer of Light...

dialogue.name: HYDAELYN
dialogue.text: Brave gatherer of the Crystals...thy soul burneth bright!

dialogue.name: HYDAELYN
dialogue.text: I am Hydaelyn. All made one.

dialogue.name: HYDAELYN
dialogue.text: Hearken unto me now, for the Darkness doth begin to spread.

dialogue.name: HYDAELYN
dialogue.text: Ware thee the bearer of the Crimson Brand, for he is the Avatar of Shadow, whom death attendeth always.

dialogue.name: HYDAELYN
dialogue.text: The Crystals shall be thy salvation─thy blade and shield both.

dialogue.name: HYDAELYN
dialogue.text: Steel thyself, for at the appointed hour...

dialogue.name: HYDAELYN
dialogue.text: Thou shalt stare into the Heart of Darkness.

dialogue.name: HYDAELYN
dialogue.text: Go with caution, my child, but fear not─for I am ever with thee.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Y'shtola!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Forename. I see you and Alphinaud are safe. And...and Cid.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That we five should meet each other thus defies simple explanation. It is as if the benevolent hand of Master Louisoix guides us still.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: He would not see us undone so easily. Not now, when the need is so great.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I know where Minfilia and the others are being held.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Where?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: An imperial stronghold in the heart of Mor Dhona─Castrum Centri.

dialogue.name: ELYENORA
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir. Do you wish to proceed to your vessel?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I...I had no idea, Forename. I can only imagine how you felt when you returned that day...
